result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale E. LANE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order for Sentence Credit.
It is hereby ordered that:
1) the defendant is granted two (2) days of sentence credit on 15 CM 112.  The Clerk of Courts is hereby directed to prepare an Amended Judgment of Conviction to reflect the sentence credit, and shall note in the comments section that this credit is only to be applied if the defendant is revoked from probation;
2) the defendant is granted two (2) days of sentene credit for the dismissed and read in case no: 15 CM 168.  The Clerk of Court is hereby directed to prepare an amended judgment of conviction for 15 CF 146 to reflect the sentence credit for this dismissed but read in case, and shall note in the comments section that this credit is only applied if the defendant is revoked from probation.
Cover letter.
Letter from MRR to Attorney William Donarski.
to Attorney Griesbach from MRR, re:  sentence credit.

Transcript of plea and sentencing hearing held on 06-12-15.
Original transcript is on file in case no: 15 CF 146.

Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in all counts.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 146 and 15 CM 112.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-10-15 at 10:30 a.m.   Plea date is set for 07-20-15 at 11:00 a.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of obstruct officer, disorderly conduct and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department  fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
